hints.label: unlabeled-proof-22
hints.content:
517: 
518: :::{prf:proof}
519: This is a classical result. For the product measure $\pi = \bigotimes_{i=1}^N \pi_i$ and function $f(x_1, \ldots, x_N)$:
520: 
521: $$
522: \text{Ent}_\pi(f^2) \le \sum_{i=1}^N \mathbb{E}_{\pi}\left[\text{Ent}_{\pi_i}(f^2 | x_1, \ldots, x_{i-1}, x_{i+1}, \ldots, x_N)\right]
523: $$
524: 
525: Each conditional entropy satisfies the single-particle LSI:
526: 
527: $$
528: \text{Ent}_{\pi_i}(f^2 | \cdots) \le C_i \mathcal{E}_i(f, f | \cdots)
529: $$
530: 
531: Summing over $i$ and taking $C = \max_i C_i$:
532: 
533: $$
534: \text{Ent}_\pi(f^2) \le C \sum_{i=1}^N \mathcal{E}_i(f, f) = C \mathcal{E}_{\text{product}}(f, f)
